title: 1984 French Open – Men's singles
text:
<a href="Ivan%20Lendl">Ivan Lendl</a> defeated <a href="John%20McEnroe">John McEnroe</a> in the final, 3–6, 2–6, 6–4, 7–5, 7–5 to win the men's singles tennis title at the 1984 French Open. It was his first <a href="Grand%20Slam%20%28tennis%29%23Tournaments">major</a> title. It was also McEnroe's first defeat of the <a href="1984%20Grand%20Prix%20%28tennis%29">season</a>, and his only final appearance at the <a href="clay%20courts">clay courts</a> of the <a href="French%20Open">French Open</a>.
<a href="Yannick%20Noah">Yannick Noah</a> was the defending champion, but lost to <a href="Mats%20Wilander">Mats Wilander</a> in the quarterfinals in a rematch of the previous year's final.
